ClinicalDocument.title: National Ambulatory Medical Care Survey: In-Patient Encounter (NHCS-IP)

dischargeDispositionCode.displayName: Discharged/transferred to skilled nursing facility (SNF) with Medicare certification in anticipation of covered skilled care

tr.th: Expected Source(s) of Payment for this Visit

list.item:
Encounter Diagnosis
Hypertensive disorder, systemic arterial (disorder)

AdmissionHistoryandPhysical
HISTORY - 82 yo Caucasian male living in a residential care facility with Parkinson’s disease, type 2 diabetes and CAD. He is being treated for PD with carbidopa10mg/levodopa 100 mg 3 times per day and for diabetes with metformin 500 mg. He went to the ED with fever, productive cough and shortness of breath developed during the past three days. Upon arrival to the ED he was put on IV fluids. Rapid influenza antigen test and blood culture were performed. The chest X-ray reveals infiltrates in the lower lobes bilaterally. A diagnosis of influenza A was done and he was admitted with Ceftriaxone 1 g every 12 hours and oseltamivir 75 mg twice a day. PHYSICAL - Neck: No adenopathy, no masses, no palpable thyroid.; Chest: decreased breath sounds, egophony and increased tactile fremitus; Heart: normal S1 and S2. No S4 gallop; Abdomen: Bowel sounds present. Nontender to palpation. Liver edge and spleen not felt. CVAT negative. Murphy negative; Extremity: no edema. No cyanosis. No clubbing; Neurological: alert, oriented.
